text: I accept your nomination to run and
serve as vice president this is my cheer
White House correspondent for the New
York Times we're here in Cleveland at
the Republican National Convention where
Mike Pence finished giving his
acceptance speech for the vice
presidential nomination it was by all
accounts one of the first very
traditional convention speeches that
we've had here in this three days so far
the light of my lives my mom Nancy it
was exactly the kind of speech you would
expect at a convention he introduced his
family he introduced his wife he made a
few jokes you know he's a man known for
a large personality a colorful style and
lots of charisma and so I guess he was
just looking for some balance on the
ticket he became serious and talked
about foreign policy and domestic policy
we've seen entire stretches of our
country written off by bad economic
policies in ways that are deeply unfair
to American workers and ultimately ended
day three of the Republican convention
here by rousing the crowd behind the
election of Donald Trump and my fellow
Republicans when Donald Trump becomes
president of the United States of
America the change will be huge
